description: Complete reference for generating Excalidraw diagrams programmatically

entries.title: Excalidraw File Structure
entries.summary: Top-level structure of an Excalidraw JSON file
entries.content: An Excalidraw file contains elements array, appState for editor settings, and files for embedded images.

entries.title: Rectangle Element
entries.summary: Create rectangular shapes for boxes, containers, services
entries.content: Rectangles are the most common element for representing services, components, and containers in architecture diagrams.

entries.title: Ellipse Element
entries.summary: Create elliptical shapes for databases, start/end nodes
entries.content: Ellipses are commonly used to represent databases (cylinder-like) and start/end points in flowcharts.

entries.title: Diamond Element
entries.summary: Create diamond shapes for decisions, cache, or special components
entries.content: Diamonds are used for decision points in flowcharts and can represent cache layers in architecture diagrams.

entries.title: Text Element
entries.summary: Add text labels, annotations, and titles
entries.content: Text elements are used for labels inside shapes, standalone annotations, and titles. Use fontFamily 1 for Virgil (hand-drawn), 2 for Helvetica, 3 for Cascadia.

entries.title: Arrow Element
entries.summary: Connect elements with arrows to show data flow or relationships
entries.content: Arrows connect elements using startBinding and endBinding. Points array defines the path relative to the arrow origin.

entries.title: Line Element
entries.summary: Create lines for separators, borders, or custom paths
entries.content: Lines are similar to arrows but without arrowheads. Useful for separators and decorative elements.

entries.title: Database Colors
entries.summary: Purple color scheme for database components
entries.content: Use purple tones for all database-related components: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.

entries.title: Cache Colors
entries.summary: Red color scheme for cache components
entries.content: Use red tones for cache layers: Redis, Memcached, ElastiCache.

entries.title: Message Queue Colors
entries.summary: Green color scheme for message queue components
entries.content: Use green tones for message queues: Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, Pub/Sub.

entries.title: Load Balancer Colors
entries.summary: Teal color scheme for load balancer components
entries.content: Use teal/cyan tones for load balancers: Nginx, HAProxy, ALB, ELB.

entries.title: Gateway Colors
entries.summary: Gray color scheme for gateway components
entries.content: Use neutral gray tones for API gateways: Kong, Apigee, AWS API Gateway.

entries.title: Auth Colors
entries.summary: Rose/pink color scheme for authentication components
entries.content: Use rose/pink tones for auth components: OAuth, JWT, Cognito, Keycloak.

entries.title: Storage Colors
entries.summary: Amber color scheme for storage components
entries.content: Use amber/yellow tones for object storage: S3, Azure Blob, GCS.

entries.title: Service Colors
entries.summary: Blue color scheme for service/API components
entries.content: Use blue tones for backend services, APIs, and microservices.

entries.title: Monitoring Colors
entries.summary: Lime/green color scheme for monitoring components
entries.content: Use lime tones for monitoring: Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog.

entries.title: Architecture Diagram Layout
entries.summary: Layer-based layout for architecture diagrams
entries.content: Organize components in horizontal layers from client to infrastructure. Use consistent spacing between layers and components.

code_examples.code:
Layer 1 (Client):       y = 100
Layer 2 (Edge/CDN):     y = 280
Layer 3 (Gateway/LB):   y = 460
Layer 4 (Services):     y = 640
Layer 5 (Data/Cache):   y = 820
Layer 6 (Infra):        y = 1000

Horizontal spacing: 240px
Vertical spacing: 180px
Component width: 180px
Component height: 80px

entries.title: Flowchart Layout
entries.summary: Sequential layout for flowcharts
entries.content: Arrange steps left-to-right or top-to-bottom with consistent spacing. Use rectangles for processes, diamonds for decisions, ellipses for start/end.

code_examples.code:
Start x = 100, y = 100
Step spacing = 200px
Step width = 140px
Step height = 60px

Elements:
- Ellipse: start/end nodes
- Rectangle: process steps
- Diamond: decision points

entries.title: Mind Map Layout
entries.summary: Radial layout for mind maps
entries.content: Place the central topic at center, distribute child nodes radially around it using trigonometric calculations.

code_examples.code:
center_x = 400
center_y = 300
radius = 250

for i, child in enumerate(children):
    angle_rad = 2 * pi * i / len(children)
    child_x = center_x + radius * cos(angle_rad)
    child_y = center_y + radius * sin(angle_rad)

entries.title: Modern Style
entries.summary: Clean, professional modern style
entries.content: Sharp edges, solid fills, minimal roughness. Good for professional documentation.

entries.title: Sketchy Style
entries.summary: Hand-drawn informal style
entries.content: High roughness, hachure fills, Cascadia font. Good for brainstorming and informal diagrams.

entries.title: Element Grouping
entries.summary: Group related elements together
entries.content: Use groupIds to keep shapes and their labels together. All elements in a group should share the same groupId.

entries.title: Complete Architecture Diagram
entries.summary: Full example of a 3-tier architecture diagram
entries.content: Complete example showing client, API gateway, service, and database layers with proper connections.

entries.title: AWS Architecture Icons Library
entries.summary: 248 AWS service icons for cloud architecture diagrams
entries.content: Professional AWS service icons including CloudSearch, EMR, Lake Formation, Kinesis, Lambda, S3, EC2, RDS, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, API Gateway, CloudFront, Route53, IAM, Cognito, and many more.

code_examples.code:
from library_manager import LibraryManager

manager = LibraryManager()
manager.load_libraries()

# Find AWS Lambda icon
lambda_icon = manager.find_component('lambda')
elements = lambda_icon.instantiate(x=100, y=100)

entries.title: System Design Library
entries.summary: 24 system design components for architecture diagrams
entries.content: Includes application_server, multi_instance_server, server, relational_db, object_storage, and other common system design elements.

code_examples.code:
Components: application_server, multi_instance_server, server,
multi_instance, relational_db, object_storage, and more

entries.title: System Design Template Library
entries.summary: 8 pre-built templates for system design diagrams
entries.content: Templates including steps, flow, table_label, separator, db for quickly scaffolding system design diagrams.

code_examples.code: Templates: steps, flow, table_label, separator, db

entries.title: Software Architecture Library
entries.summary: 7 software architecture components
entries.content: Basic software architecture building blocks for component diagrams.

entries.title: Draw.io Style Library
entries.summary: 18 Draw.io style components
entries.content: Draw.io compatible icons and shapes including JSON visualization and other diagram elements.

entries.title: How to Use Icon Libraries
entries.summary: Load and use icons from .excalidrawlib files
entries.content: Use LibraryManager to load icons, search by keyword, and instantiate at specific positions.

code_examples.code:
from library_manager import LibraryManager

# Initialize and load
manager = LibraryManager()
manager.load_libraries()

# Search for component
component = manager.find_component('redis')

# Instantiate at position with optional scale
if component:
    elements = component.instantiate(x=200, y=300, scale=1.0)
    # elements is a list of Excalidraw element dicts
    # Add to your diagram's elements array
